My Journey to Data Storyteller

Exploring the intersection of data, storytelling, and human connection

Read My Blog

About Me

I'm currently a Master of Business Analytics and AI student at Ontario Tech University. Former frontend developer with 8+ years of experience, I've lived in the US for 7 years and Berlin, Germany for 8 years before coming to Canada.

I love coffee and snow, and I'm now passionate about data visualization and storytelling. Through this blog, I share my journey exploring the intersection of data, analytics, and human connection.

Let's Connect

I'd love to hear from you! Whether you have questions, want to collaborate, or just want to share your own data storytelling experiences.

Notes on today's Ethic in AI class

September 17, 2025

Today we discuss the 6 initiatives for 5 principles in Ethical AI. Our professor points out that all these initiatives are from the western countries but I wonder if it‚Äôs because ai and technology are usually coming from the western world thus, the ethic topic comes along with them. We do lack of views from other countries but I wonder what input will we get. but if we are just talking about the basic ethic priciples then it‚Äôll be a way broader but interesting topic. For example, in indigenous people there are 5 genders, these are male, female, a male with a female spirit, a female with a male spirit, and a body with both spirits. So this is definitely not from the western or christian pov, and worth condsidering for ethics problems.

Another topic i like to talk about is gender inequality. For example, most cars are designed for men, and it‚Äôs not suitable for women, and if that‚Äôs the reason we have accident, the men laugh at us becuase we are ‚ÄúWomen‚Äù so we don‚Äôt drive as good as them but they design it to fit their needs not ours. So who‚Äôs the wrong here?

All these questions lead me to think: who am i to determine how we should behave?
